Notes: The Alabama Power Company established its corporate archives and museum in 1986 to document the history of the company, its predecessors, and holding companies.  The archives also documents the company's role in the economic development of Alabama and the growth of electric power generation throughout the southeast.  Holdings total approximately 1,000 cubic feet of records including:  incorporation papers, correspondence of company leaders, legal documents, company and electric power industry publications, graphic materials, photographs and motion pictures, artifacts, and sound recordings.  These holdings illustrate, among other topics, the development of electric power in Alabama, attraction of industry to the state, controversies over the establishment of the Tennessee Valley Authority, and the founding of the Southern Research Institute.
Source of Repository Data: Alabama Department of Archives and History
